name: White Chocolate Mousse
instruction: Melt the white chocolate in a double boiler. Whip the cream until stiff peaks form. Fold the melted chocolate and vanilla extract into the whipped cream. Chill before serving.

name: No-Bake Peanut Butter Oatmeal Bars
instruction: Mix peanut butter and honey in a saucepan over low heat until melted. Remove from heat and stir in oats. Press into a pan and top with melted chocolate chips. Chill until firm.

name: Vanilla Mug Cake
instruction: Mix all ingredients in a mug until smooth. Microwave on high for 90 seconds. Let cool slightly before eating.

name: No-Bake Strawberry Icebox Cake
instruction: Layer graham crackers, whipped cream (whipped with powdered sugar), and sliced strawberries in a dish. Repeat layers and chill for at least 4 hours before serving.

name: Easy Strawberry Sorbet
instruction: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Pour into an ice cream maker and churn according to manufacturer’s instructions. Freeze until firm.

name: Microwave Peanut Butter Fudge
instruction: Melt peanut butter and butter in the microwave. Stir in powdered sugar until smooth. Pour into a lined pan and chill until firm.

name: Fluffy Key Lime Pie
instruction: Mix condensed milk and lime juice until thickened. Fold in whipped topping. Pour into crust and chill until set.

name: Chocolate Lava Mug Cake
instruction: Mix all ingredients in a mug until smooth. Microwave on high for 70-90 seconds until the cake is just set. Let cool slightly before eating.

name: Affogato
instruction: Scoop ice cream into a bowl. Pour hot espresso over the top and serve immediately.

name: Easy Fresh Strawberry Pie
instruction: Mix sugar and cornstarch in a saucepan. Add strawberries and cook until thickened. Pour into baked pie crust and chill until set.

name: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
instruction: Mix pretzels, sugar, and melted butter; press into a pan and bake. Combine cream cheese and whipped topping, spread over pretzel layer. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, add strawberries, and pour over cream cheese layer. Chill until set.

name: Homemade Chocolate Pudding
instruction: In a saucepan, combine sugar, cocoa, cornstarch, and salt. Gradually stir in milk and cook until thickened. Remove from heat, add butter and vanilla. Pour into individual dishes and chill.

name: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies
instruction: Mix all ingredients together. Roll into balls, place on a baking sheet, and flatten with a fork. Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes.

name: German Chocolate Cake
instruction: Melt chocolate in boiling water. Cream butter and sugar, add egg yolks. Add melted chocolate and vanilla. Alternately add flour mixture and buttermilk. Fold in beaten egg whites. Pour into pans and bake.

name: Black Bottom Cupcakes
instruction: Mix cream cheese, egg, sugar, and chocolate chips. Combine dry ingredients, add wet ingredients, and mix. Fill cupcake liners with chocolate batter, top with cream cheese mixture. Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.

name: Apple-Cider Doughnut Cake
instruction: Combine dry ingredients. Mix cider, butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Combine wet and dry ingredients, pour into a Bundt pan, and bake. Coat with cinnamon-sugar mixture after baking.

name: Pumpkin Cupcakes
instruction: Mix dry ingredients. Combine pumpkin, sugar, oil, and eggs. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Pour into cupcake liners and bake. Frost with cream cheese frosting.

name: Lemon Cheesecake
instruction: Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and butter. Press into pan. Beat cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice, and zest. Add eggs one at a time. Pour over crust and bake.
